conclusion: The graph shows two lines, a and b, representing the terminal voltage U and current I of a silicon photocell and a resistor R respectively.
The intersection point of lines a and b is at I = 0.2 A and U = 2.5 V.
Line b has a slope of 12.5 Ω, indicating the resistance R.
Line a has a slope of -25 Ω at the intersection point, which represents the internal resistance r of the silicon photocell.
The internal resistance r of the silicon photocell is 25 Ω.
